subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00C3_01C865E4.767754E0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Steve,

I certainly appreciate your thoughts.  In the back of my mind is al=
ways the question of whether we are being Deceived.  Just for the sake of a=
rgument, is it POSSIBLE we're being manipulated by something evil?  I'm not=
 frightened, and I won't stop my own research (the negative stuff just make=
s me more determined), but my mind does go there sometimes.  I hope that al=
ong with developing my "ear" I can acquire the gift of discernment.

Robin
=


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Steve Hultay<mailto:urkel23@aol.c=
om> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent:=
 Saturday, February 02, 2008 8:57 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from ton=
ight:


  Robin,

  If i may add my thoughts on this: There is no concrete =
evidence of 
  who or what comes through is what they say they are. Technic=
ians i 
  have found were used to get you up and running and i only now cal=
l on 
  them if i need assistance. I don't turn the boxes on and ask for 
 =
 them like a crutch, i conduct my session and if i need help they will 
  s=
upply it to me if needed. I think the whole idea is to find out who 
  we a=
re communicating with, maybe we will never really know for sure 
  but i st=
ill try and find out as best as i can. 

  -Steve H.

  --- In EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, "Robin Searcy Henson" 
  <Mu=
dPuddleFarm@...> wrote:
  >
  > Hi Frank, 
  > 
  > When you mention being =
distrustful of what comes through the boxes, 
  are you saying you're skept=
ical of the "technicians" being who they 
  say they are? Not trying to ope=
n another can of worms here, just 
  wanting to continue learning from your=
 experience and research. I 
  get what you're saying about becoming obsess=
ive with the sessions. 
  I've probably asked you this a half dozen times o=
ver the last couple 
  of years, but who or what do YOU think you're/we're =
communicating 
  with?
  > 
  > Robin
  > 
  > 
  > ----- Original Message =
----- 
  > From: purplespacefriend<mailto:purplealiengirl@...> 
  > To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com><mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>> 
  > Sent: Saturday, February=
 02, 2008 7:46 PM
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight
  > 
  > 
  =
> Have ya tried EVPmaker? It is based on that random principle, and 
  > pr=
edates the boxes.
  > 
  > I've heard this stuff before, about random being=
 the best, and I 
  > have to disaggree. I also think it unwise to spend ev=
ery waking 
  > moment doing sessions. I think it creates that expectation,=
 and 
  > perhaps desperation to make contact, and I would tend not to 
  t=
rust 
  > what comes through. 
  > 
  > I don't trust some of this stuff be=
cause I have yet get any 
  > meaningful assistence with the boxes from the=
 so called 
  technicians. 
  > All I ever got was a telepathic "suggestion=
" to use the echo 
  boxes. 
  > Everything else was a assemblage of stuff =
I had worked on in hte 
  past 
  > to solve the problem of "what else coul=
d I use". 
  > 
  > I hate to see yet another go down the road of "this is =
the 
  onlyest 
  > way". 
  > 
  > Frank-S
  >
